Ça me gave.
Choose a level.

Hé ouais, 2 niveaux.
Ça te cloue le bec !

Là, l'oie, c'est moi !
Choose a level.

Ça casse pas 3 pattes à un canard.
Choose a level.

Me vole pas dans les plumes.
Choose a level.

Prêt à canarder ?
Choose a level.

Dépêche, fait un froid de canard.

objects.name: Controls
objects.string:
arrows and RShift - ESDF and LShift - IJKL and H - 8456 and 0
or gamepads

events.comment: Settings chosen in the scene "Selection" are applied.

Explosions are created square by square. The direction is given by the variables ExplosionDirection, ExplosionDirectionX et ExplosionDirectionY. They are set in the Explosion event page.
The variable iteration allows to know how many squares from the center to put the next explosion sprite.
The arm squares (+11) are over the finger squares (+10) and the center squares are over the other 2 (+12). It makes a better continuity on the explosions sprites.
When an obstacle is reached, the loop is broken (by setting a big value in the iteration variable).
Random bonus creation
The crate is removed after because its location is used to create the bonus.

A more accurate version for the assistance is proposed here:
https://github.com/4ian/GDevelop/pull/2153

To change direction the player must be perfectly aligned. It's a very frustrating thing to do so he must be helped.
The pressed key gives the player intent. If he presses left, he wants to go that way, but he needs to be aligned to do so, so the assistance makes him move up or down in the 1st place.
The player is helped only he intent to move to avoid strange behaviors when the player has still some inertia.
Does any obstacle need to be bypass?
The player is not on the edge of the obstacle. The player intent may be to stay on that wall, no assistance is needed.

The player is assisted only if he would go further in the obstacle according to its direction.
Otherwise, it's just a parasite collision certainly because the corridor is a pixel perfect fit.
The player intents to move vertically
Can the player go in the direction he wants?
The player intents to move horizontally.
Can the player go in the direction he wants?

The player is set back to the location from before he was pull apart because all the obstacles in collision must be evaluated to seek out contradictory assistances.
(See below comment for further explanations)

Once every obstacle is evaluated, the direction assistance is applied. Contradictory decisions are dismissed.
This can happen, for instance, with a wall composed of squares. Taken apart from one to another, a square could be bypass one the right and the next one on the left even though they are side by side and the player can't actually go between them.
The collision is evaluated and really applied at the end to be sure no sprite overlaps each other.
Creation of the central explosion square
Creation of the explosion squares on the 4 directions
Give the player its bomb back
The player variables can't be used in an expression if no condition nor action referred to it. The repeat loop takes that role.

Check that no bomb is already on this square.
The variable allows to do a negation of "Is there at least one bomb on this square?" to obtain "Is there no bomb on this square?".
This is not the same as having the negation directly on the condition because it would mean "Is there a bomb that is not on this square?".

The variable HasJustBeenPut allows to apply some actions on the created bombes without the player in the context.
Otherwise, the loop on the players wouldn't work because GDevelop couldn't tell on which player to apply actions.
Other players can be on the square where the bomb is put.
The player no longer overlaps the bomb. It becomes solid for him.
A bomb can explode because of the detonator...
...or by chain reaction

OtherExplosion is a group that only contains Explosion.
This avoid to include Explosion instances to the context because it would conflict with the one that is created and used in sub-events.
It seems that the animation frame rate can only be constant. So, the animation is split to make the last frame last.
Called in "Game" and "Death".
Every death counts.
Dead player come back to their initial location.
The bonus accumulated by the dead player come back to their initial locations.
The structure Bonus of the Player allow to keep up the bonuses caught by the player and their location so they can be set back when he dies.
Players are just filled squares so it's easier to set the collision mask. Geese are used to skin them.
Objects on the top are farer than those from the bottom.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, axis force, trigger pressure, deadzone for each gamepad, etc...

Up to 4 gamepads can be connected: for each condition or expression, you'll have to enter the index of the gamepad to read. This is 1, 2,3 or 4.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of the pressure on a gamepad trigger.
eventsFunctions.name: TriggerPressure

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the force value of a gamepad stick.
0 is stick on default position, 1 is at the maximum.
eventsFunctions.name: StickForce

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the rotation value of a gamepad stick.
If the deadzone value is high, the angle value is rounded to main axes, left, left, up, down.
An zero deadzone value give a total freedom on the angle value.
eventsFunctions.name: StickRotationValue

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of axis of a gamepad stick.
eventsFunctions.name: AxisValue

eventsFunctions.description:
Test if a button is released on a gamepad. Buttons can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Other: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT"
eventsFunctions.name: C_Button_released

eventsFunctions.description: Return the index of the last pressed button of a gamepad
eventsFunctions.name: LastButtonID

eventsFunctions.description: Check if any button is pressed on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Any_Button_pressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Any button of gamepad _PARAM1_ is pressed

eventsFunctions.description:
Return the last button pressed. 
Buttons for Xbox and PS4 can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Both: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT"
eventsFunctions.name: LastButtonString

parameters.description: Controller type "XBOX" or "PS4". This defines the type of button names to return as a string. "Mapping not exist" is returned if invalid type is used.
parameters.name: controller_type

eventsFunctions.description:
Check if a button is pressed on a gamepad. 
Buttons can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Other: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT"
eventsFunctions.name: C_Button_pressed

eventsFunctions.description: Return the value of the deadzone applied to a gamepad sticks, between 0 and 1.
eventsFunctions.name: Deadzone

eventsFunctions.description: Set the deadzone for sticks of the gamepad. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved). Deadzone is between 0 and 1, and is by default 0.2.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Set_deadzone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set deadzone for sticks on gamepad: _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

parameters.description: Deadzone for sticks, 0.2 by default (0 to 1)
parameters.name: deadzone

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a stick of a gamepad is pushed in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Axis_pushed
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM2_ stick of gamepad _PARAM1_ is pushed in direction _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the number of connected gamepads
eventsFunctions.name: ConnectedGamepadsCount

eventsFunctions.description: Return a string containing informations about the specified gamepad
eventsFunctions.name: GamepadType

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified gamepad has the specified information in its description. Useful to know if the gamepad is a Xbox or PS4 controller.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Controller_type

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a gamepad is connected.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Controller_X_is_connected

eventsFunctions.description: Generate a vibration on the specified controller. Might only work if the game is running in a recent web browser.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Vibrate_controller

parameters.description: Time of the vibration, in seconds (optional, default value is 1)
parameters.name: duration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if any button is released on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: C_any_button_released
eventsFunctions.sentence: Any button of gamepad _PARAM1_ is released

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Make the object come back to its initial location
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Respawn

eventsFunctions.description: Respawn to its initial location
eventsFunctions.name: respawn

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is invincible.
eventsFunctions.name: isInvincible

propertyDescriptors.label: The invincibility time after been respawn (in seconds).
propertyDescriptors.name: InvincibilityTime
